question.title: Rotation of square Matrix not working correctly after first rotation
question.body:
Please check the below code, the mat array after the second rotation should be identical to the target array tar. However, it is not happening. Could you please review to check where the logic is going wrong?

// input
int[][] mat = {{0, 0, 0}, {0, 1, 0}, {1, 1, 1}};

// **target matrix that should be achieved after second
// rotation of mat, i.e, 180 degree, but isn't working????**
int[][] tar = {{1, 1, 1}, {0, 1, 0}, {0, 0, 0}};

int[][] ans = new int[mat.length][mat.length];

//////First rotation/////////
for (int i = 0; i < mat.length; i++) {
    int x = mat.length - 1 - i;
    for (int j = 0; j < mat.length; j++) {
        ans[j][x] = mat[i][j];
    }
}

mat = ans;

// Second rotation-----------------------------
for (int i = 0; i < mat.length; i++) {
    int x = mat.length - 1 - i;
    for (int j = 0; j < mat.length; j++) {
        ans[j][x] = mat[i][j];
    }
}
//**not matching to target, but it should!!! HELPPPP**
for (int[] e : ans) {
    System.out.println(Arrays.toString(e));
}

answers.body:
This looks like a reference issue. By writing mat = ans they both point at the same object. Then ans[j][x] = mat[i][j] will modify only one object and actually destroy information.

After writing mat = ans, reassign ans to a new nested array.
